America to start actually arming EF
troops effectively
the report calls for provision of
serious money a billion dollars in this
fiscal year although most of those funds
would go to non-lethal assistance the
one thing that the Ukrainians really
need our counter better radars
that would allow them to detect the
origin of incoming rocket and artillery
strikes which caused probably about 70%
of the Ukrainian casualties but we also
argue that the US government should
change its position and allow provision
of lethal defensive weapons in
particular light anti-armor weapons
because both NATO and Ukraine told us
when we were there in in mid-january
that they've seen a huge influx of
Russian armor coming across the border
from Russia into eastern Ukraine okay
what reception have you had from the
White House to this proposal because so
far the White House has been resistant
to provide lethal assistance we did
brief this report to senior government
officials late last week I guess I came
with a couple of impressions one is they
listened very interested with interest
they said the report was very timely and
the impression that I think I came with
and my co-authors is that this right now
is a very live issue within the US
government much more so than say a
couple of months ago when you were there
you mentioned the fact that there's been
this influx of troops coming across the
border from Russia would you classify
this as an invasion well there are
Russian military forces on Ukrainian
territory without the vision of the
Ukrainian government I think most
countries would consider that an
invasion now we did hear a little bit of
in terms what NATO said they saw were
Russian officers who are doing advising
and training of separatists what the
Ukrainian said was no they actually are
Russian armed Russian units organized in
eastern Ukraine you've called on the
United States and NATO to step up as you
just said if they don't what do you
think happens in East Ukraine well the
concern right now is that the Russians
have military options and and we're not
trying to win this war militarily the
idea here is to give the Ukrainians the
military capability to raise the cost to
Russia of escalation or aggression and
hopefully take that option off the table
for Moscow and then steer them towards
where this should be which is a
negotiated solution or a real ceasefire
which is not holding now but then moving
on to a real negotiation on the
political settlement it's some of the
resistance in the white house up until
now has been let's do the sanctions
route because we don't want to aggravate
the situation we don't want to provoke
Putin too much are you concerned at all
about that or you think we've gone too
far well I think we've heard also I
think one of the reasons why the US
government has not gone is there's is a
concern that would the Russians escalate
but I think the view of our group is if
you look over the last 10 months the
Russians have escalated and so now
really the rationale for helping the
Ukrainians build up their defense
capabilities is so that they can
discourage the Russians from further
escalation and the kind of things that
we just saw on your report that's taking
place around Donetsk and abhava and even
some concerns that there might be a
Russian and separatist push to even go
further okay a bustah pie for thanks
very much for coming thank you
